column4: can anyone help me with getting twinview, or ANY form of full-resolution dual monitor working?
i've got a nvidia 7900 with the nvidia restricted drivers
gksudo nvidia-settings opens up a dialog with no options to configure monitors
it's a bit involved -- read the README.txt.gz in /usr/share/doc/nvidia-glx -- also see the factoid:
easiest is to login on a text console (Ctrl-Alt-F1 -- switch back to Xserver with Ctrl-Alt-F7 or -F9)
thanks. what command would i use to copy whole folder structures to another folder?
cp -a (consult man cp)
thanks
if you're copying  /dev directories, look at the tar technique suggested by Alan Cox in the Tips-HOWTO
then it's metacity --replace
i can't even open a terminal because of it
so switch to a text console, log in and run 'export DISPLAY=:0 ; metacity --replace'
thanks:D
any likely candidates for a proxy variable setting?
what do you mean?
sorry, I'm confusing nicks
for your apache problem, you probably just have to make your NTFS writable with ntfs-3g
that's awesome. shame i just finished copying all my data to another partition and it'll be easiest (According to those who helped me with it earlier)
they are probably right
sun-java6-plugin is only available for i386. Is that what you're on?
yes
you need to restart firefox once you've installed the sun-java6-plugin package
I didn't even have firefox open
